H0.text: What metabolic disorder takes its name from Greek 'siphon', referring to excessive urine production. Polyuria

H1.text: What metabolic disorder takes its name from Greek 'siphon', referring to excessive urine production. Hyperglycosuria

H2.text: What metabolic disorder takes its name from Greek 'siphon', referring to excessive urine production. Glycosuria

H3.text: What metabolic disorder takes its name from Greek 'siphon', referring to excessive urine production. Diabedis

A4.text: The word diabetes literally means 'a passer through; a siphon'.

A5.text: Ancient Greek physician Aretaeus of Cappadocia used that word with the intended meaning 'excessive discharge of urine' as the name for the disease.
